title: Man Utd told they would win Premier League and Champions League in three years if they hired Allegri
text:
Massimiliano Allegri has reportedly spoken to Manchester United about replacing Ole Gunnar Solskjaer (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United would win the Premier League title within two years if they replaced Ole Gunnar Solskjaer with Massimiliano Allegri. That’s according to former Juventus director Luciano Moggi.

The Red Devils have had a miserable start to the campaign, winning just two of their eight matches in the English top flight ahead of this weekend’s clash with league leaders Liverpool.

Widespread reports in Italy claim that Allegri and United have held ‘concrete’ talks over the last few weeks, with Solskjaer under considerable pressure.

Allegri had planned to take a 12-month sabbatical after stepping down as Juve boss in the summer, but it’s understood the 52-year-old is now ‘very close’ to becoming United manager.

United have won just two league matches under Solskjaer this season (Picture: Getty)

On the prospect of Allegri taking charge at Old Trafford, Moggi told The Daily Mail: ‘Allegri is the best possible option for United.

‘With all due respect to Moyes and Solskjaer, Allegri is better than both.

‘He will bring United back to winning the championship and competing against Juventus, Real Madrid, Barcelona and Liverpool.

‘I’m sure that in two years, United would be triumphant in the Premier League with him on the bench.’

Ex-Juve and Italy defender Moreno Torricelli agrees that Allegri would bring success back to United and believes the Italian would win the Champions League within three years.

‘It will take time to get the club back to other levels but Allegri will succeed,’ Torricelli said.

‘And in three years he will be King of Europe.’
